Far Cry 2, often regarded as the best game in the series, is an open world first person shooter released in 2008. Unlike it's predecessor, Far Cry 2 has been developed and published by Ubisoft instead of Crytek. 

Far Cry 2 was a milestone. This game really set the tone for what the series is now. The games set in an African country which is shattered by a war between the two factions, that strive for power, the UFLL and the APR. To start a mission you have to accept a mission from either of them, you can not do both. Means you have to decide which faction to support. There is no obvious choice though, both factions are morally corrupted and only act in their own interest. There comes the buddy missions. In the game you can have a buddy, the buddy will give you alternative missions which you can do instead of supporting either of the factions directly, but the buddies can die and will not return. After all of the buddies died there is no replacement and therefore no more buddymissions. So it's important to keep them protected. During the mission you can decide to neither fulfill your contractors mission or you can follow the buddy missions, which take longer, but aren't supporting the factions directly. In the beginning you select one of many characters, you will encounter the rest of the characters as buddies. In the beginning of the game you get infected with a rather nasty batch of malaria and now have to take missions from the factions, to be able to get the necessary medication. Your real aim is it, to kill the Jackal, an arms dealer who sells guns to both parties and profits of the casualties. 

The game is really well done and the gameplay still holds up largely, the only thing I might say is worse than Far Cry 3 is the lack of stealth opportunities and takedowns. There is only 1 takedown possible and also only a shotgun and a pistol which have a silencer as well as a precision rifle which uses poisonous darts. The gunplay is actually really good though and definitely one of the Highlights. Idk what Ubisoft fucked up in later titles but this was awesome. The highlight of the game are the animations though, from having to unjam your guns to realigning bones. The healing animations are with the best you'll ever see in a game. 

All in all the game is still great I'm and barely causes problems on modern hardware, the few ones that can happen, can be easily fixed. 

As I have stated before, Far Cry 2 is still often regarded as the best far cry game in the series and I can definitely see why. The game is really awesome. The question often comes down to: "is it better than Far Fry 3" and I think this is honestly a bad question. Far Cry 3 of course was a huge jump and introduced not just better graphics but a vivid open world, stealth takedowns and one of the, if not the best videogame villains of all time. Though the Jackal is a really interesting villain that often gets overlooked. What I meant to say is, that Far Cry 3 might not be directly better than Far Cry 2, you just definitely can see the jump in technology as well as new mechanics. Far Cry 3 was the perfect upgrade to Far Cry 2. That doesn't make Far Cry 2 any worse though. They definitely did the best they could with the resources and limits they had in that time. Can't believe Ubisoft actually made good games. Highly recommend!!!

185533472.review:
Decided to revisit this classic after picking it up on sale. Far Cry 2 is a FPS shooter that is quite unlike any other future games in the franchise since stealth is not something that can be achieved in this game (even with silenced weapons). The game takes place in a war-torn African country where you step into a shoes of a mercenary that was sent on a mission to kill the Jackal, an infamous weapons dealer that delivered the arms to the said country.

One of the things that I liked about this game is it's simplicity and the lack of hand-holding. The game only holds your hands through the first couple of minutes in teaching you the controls and mechanics of the game and once the game is done with that it pretty much says "Alright, now that the tutorial is over, here's your guns, here's your equipment, here's your mission, and here's your malaria. Now off you go into this world, and carry out your mission in whatever way possible". From there you're free to explore the world and carry out some story and side missions that either give you more diamonds, improve relations with your buddies, or allow you to unlock new weapons of purchase.

Speaking of buddies, Far Cry 2 is the game that introduced buddies into the franchise that made a return in the future releases of Far Cry. In the Far Cry 2, your buddies are all mercenaries who are also trying to make a living in this war-torn hell hole who will offer different ways in which you can complete main missions in exchange for making various improvements to your safe house(s), one of your buddies can also come to the rescue and revive you when one of the enemies decided to one shot you by driving you over in a car.

Another mechanic of the game is the mentioned malaria with which your character gets infected at the start of the game, your character will experience a malaria attack which needs to be controlled by malaria medication, depending on what level of malaria you have (levels 1  - 5) will determine how often you have to take the medicine, and how far you can run. The malaria attacks happen randomly in the game and there's no way to forsee when they will happen. Sometimes they may happen in the middle of a firefight, sometimes while driving, or sometimes when you're just walking around exploring the world. The mechanic does get annoying a bit especially in the middle of a firefight however from my end, it's not a mechanic that bothered me that much.

The world of Far Cry 2 is covered with 51 small - medium sized outposts where each outpost has some sort of an item on it (ammo, health syringes etc.)that the player can re-fill if they ever run out of the said item. As opposed to the outposts in the later releases of the Far Cry games, these outposts do not stay cleared/liberated once all the enemies have been cleared from the outpost, which means that each outpost will have to be cleared multiple times when going about on your missions. Another drawback of the game is the lack of an autosave feature where the game can only be saved manually in liberated safe houses, or in certain areas of the world meaning that hours of progress can be lost if your character gets killed.

Despite the simplicity of Far Cry 2, I did enjoy my time playing through this game. Although the game has limited stealth in comparison with the later releases of the franchise, it is a good FPS that offers a variety of different environments, as well as weapons that you can experiment with. The game plays really well on Steam Deck and is really easy on the battery, don't think I experienced any crashes in the game through my playthrough.

185454515.review:
[b]Far Cry 2: Afrika'da Suskun Bir Adam[/b]

21 Ekim 2008 tarihinde piyasaya sürülen Far Cry 2, Ubisoft'un yenilikçi yaklaşımlarına sahne olan bir oyun. Ancak bu yenilikçi dokunuşlar, oyuncuların büyük bir kısmı için hayal kırıklığına dönüşüyor. Bu incelemede hem oyun hikayesi hem oynanış detayları hem de atmosferiyle ilgili bir çözümleme bulacaksınız.

[h1]Hikaye ve Karakterler[/h1]

Far Cry 2'nin hikayesi "İsimsiz Afrika Ülkesi"nde geçiyor. Oyuncular, bir paralı asker olarak ülkedeki kaosu besleyen çatışan iki grup (UFLL ve APR) arasında, ülkeye silah sağlayan Çakal adlı silah tüccarının peşinde koşturuluyor. Ana karakterimiz, 9 farklı paralı askerden biri olarak seçiliyor. Ancak, kimin seçildiği hikaye üzerinde hiçbir şey fark ettirmiyor. Sebebi ise basit: Ana karakter konuşmuyor! Oyunun bu tercihinin, hikayeye katkıdan çok zarar verdiği söylenebilir.

Yoldaşlarınız - oyun içindeki diğer seçilebilir karakterler - bülbül gibi şakırken ana karakterin bu suskunluğu, oyuncuyu hikayeden koparıyor. Oyun içinde ilerlemek için UFLL ve APR adlı iki grubun da görevlerini yapmak zorundasınız, ancak bu görevlerin çoğu tekrar eden "şunu öldür" türünde. Ayrıca görevlerin çeşitlilikten uzak olması, bir süre sonra monoton bir deneyime dönüşüyor.

[b]Jack Carver Efsanesi:[/b] Far Cry 1'in ana karakteri Jack Carver, bu oyunda "Çakal" olarak geri dönüyor. Bu teoriyi oyunun yönetmeni Clint Hocking, IGN'e verdiği bir röportajda doğruluyor. Ancak hikaye boyunca Çakal'ın düşüncelerindeki değişim sürecine tanık olmadığımız için bu detay gölgede kalıyor. Oyunun finalinde, Çakal'ın iki seçenek sunarak sizi feda olmaya zorlama kararlılığı, oyuncuları ikilemde bırakıyor.

Çakal'ın hikaye içindeki varlığı, gizem ve tehdit unsurlarını başarılı bir şekilde taşısa da, motivasyonlarının net bir şekilde anlatılmaması oyunun hikaye yönünde büyük bir boşluk yaratıyor. Oyuncular, bu karakterin geçmişine dair daha fazla bilgi ve sahne görmek isteyebilirdi.

[b]Son Karar:[/b] Hikaye, ilgi çekici bir potansiyele sahip olsa da suskun bir ana karakter, yeterince geliştirilmemiş yoldaş sistemi ve tekrar eden yan görevlerle bu potansiyel tam anlamıyla değerlendirilememiş.

[h1]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/h1]

Far Cry 2'nin oynanışı, hikayeden daha etkileyici unsurlar sunuyor. Özellikle çevre etkileşimi ve oynanışta gerçekçilik arayanlar için çarpıcı detaylar mevcut:

[list]
[*][b]Silah Gerçekçiliği:[/b] Kullanılan silahlar eskidikçe tutukluk yapabiliyor. Silahçıdan temiz ve dayanıklı silahlar almak, oyundaki ilerleyişiniz için şart hale geliyor. Ancak bu durum, sık sık konvoy imha etme gibi tekrarlayan görevlerle oyuncuları zorlayabiliyor.
[*][b]Ateş Dinamiği:[/b] Oyundaki yangınlar inanılmaz derecede gerçekçi. Rüzgarın yönüne göre alevlerin yayılması, çevreyle etkileşimde yeni stratejiler geliştirmenizi sağlıyor.
[*][b]Düşman Respawn'ları:[/b] Temizlenen outpost'lar düşmanlar tarafından hızla geri alınıyor. Bu durum, oyuncuyu bezdirebiliyor ve çoğu zaman gereksiz vakit kaybına yol açıyor.
[*][b]Mini Harita Eksikliği:[/b] Oyuncuları haritaya ve tabelalara bağlı bırakarak bir "hayatta kalma" hissi yaratılmak istenmiş. Ancak, bu eksiklik bazı oyuncular için sinir bozucu hale gelebiliyor.
[*][b]En İyi Arkadaş Sistemi:[/b] Çatışma sırasında düştüğünüzde en iyi arkadaşınız sizi kurtarıyor ve savaşa devam ediyor. Ancak bu sistem, tekrarlayan outpost respawn'ı nedeniyle asıl potansiyelini kaybediyor. Bu sistemin daha derinlemesine işlendiği bir mekanik oyuna çeşitlilik katabilirdi.
[*][b]Gerçekçi Harita Kullanımı:[/b] Mini harita eksikliği yerini fiziksel bir haritaya bırakıyor. Bu detay, oynanışa daha fazla "hayatta kalma" hissi katıyor. Fakat haritanın kontrolü sırasında düşman saldırılarından kaçmak bazen gereksiz yere zorlayıcı olabiliyor.
[/list]

[h1]Atmosfer ve Çevre[/h1]

Afrika'nın çarpıcı bir portresi sunulmaya çalışılmış ancak bunu başarıyla aktarmak yerine boş ve cansız bir dünyayla karşılaşıyoruz. Vahşi doğa ve hayvanların eksikliği, atmosferin etkileyiciliğini kırıyor. Sadece pasif hayvanlarla sınırlı bir doğa, Afrika'nın potansiyelini tam anlamıyla yansıtamıyor.

Oyunun sunduğu çevre detayları, belirli noktalarda gerçekten etkileyici. Özellikle rüzgarın yönüne göre savrulan otlar ve değişen hava koşulları, dünyanın görsel olarak daha gerçekçi olmasını sağlıyor. Ancak bu görsellik, içi boş bir oyun dünyasıyla bir araya geldiğinde oyuncunun ilgisini kaybetmesine neden olabiliyor.

Far Cry 2, yenilikçi oynanış mekanikleri ve atmosferik dokular sunuyor. Ancak, hikayenin zayıf kalması, çevresel hikaye anlatımı eksikliği ve oynanış tekrarı gibi problemler oyunun etkileyiciliğini baltalıyor. Yenilikçi ateş mekaniği, silah gerçekçiliği gibi unsurlar olumlu bir deneyim sunsa da, tekrar eden görevler ve cansız açık dünya oyuncunun motivasyonunu düşürebiliyor.

[b]Puan:
Hikaye: 5/10
Atmosfer: 6/10
Oynanış: 8/10
Genel: 6.5/10[/b]

Far Cry 2 teve uma evolução gráfica muito evidente. Além disso a jogabilidade mudou também e cometeram menos erros na história do que a comédia que era o primeiro jogo e é sobre estes pontos que vou explicar.

O gráfico é muito bom pra sua época, os detalhes de efeitos com fogo, as texturas de armas e veículos são bem legais e acho que esse é o ponto mais forte deste jogo, que é sua apresentação visual no ambiente africano.

A jogabilidade está mais diversificada, mais armas estão presentes nesse jogo e novos veículos estão presentes, porém os bots possuem um leve aimbot quando você fica de pé, se você agachado, parece que ficam um pouco lerdo e um pouco mais fácil de matar.

Agora a história. Sinto que é um pouco desnecessária e clichê de milicia dos diamantes, tentaram fazer um trabalho bem legal de ambientação, mas eu joguei com a sensação de faz missão e vai conversar um pouquinho, faz missão e vai conversar um pouquinho. Não era aquela palhaçada do Far Cry 1, mas não agregou tanta coisa pra falar a verdade.

Em geral é um jogo bom pra quem curte a série, levando em conta que mesmo que o jogo tem certos bugs no inicio do game e que a história não é tão forte assim, eu acredito que vale a pena sim jogar  Far Cry® 2, mas espere uma promoção para comprar o jogo, pode estar por R$29,99 em 2025, mas acredito que a promoção é a melhor saída pra um jogo já antigo.

Не зря говорят, что это великолепная игра!
Действительно у Ubisoft без Crytek'ов получилось гораздо лучше сделать игру, в сравнении с первой.
Мужики сделали свой движок и запустили эту серию заново.
Хоть и сюжет тут полностью не имеет смысла, как и задания которые вы выполняйте. Похоже на первого Ассасина. Сходи убей, сбегай взорви. Почти что 70% этой игры вы просто ездите по карте от точки A к точке B. Но не хочу сказать, что как то плохо сказалось восприятии игры. Наоборот, мне хотелось этим заниматься и брать доп. квесты которые точно такие же как и основные.
Плюсы:
- Графика своих лет.
- Разнообразное оружие.
- Очень качественные анимации всего, лечения, перезарядки, заклинивание оружия. Да и в каких играх вы видели, что у вас пушка в руках просто развалилась? Такое не в каждой современной игре увидишь. 
- Игра не легкая и не сложная, интерфейс понятный, карта идеально сделана не заблудитесь.
- У меня кончились патроны в одной пушке, вторая заклинила, потом случился приступ малярии, далее сбила машина 10/10.
Минусы:
- Не совсем минус, но на современном железе игра ведет себя странно. Из-за высокого ФПС'а NPC то летают, то дергаются, разбиваются о землю и все эти убийства игра вешает на вас. Так же курсор в этой игре не работает если вы медленно ведете мышь, стоит ускорится мышь будет следовать за вашими движениями. (Пользовался в основном "стрелочками")
- Сюжет, вы больной от малярии приехали мирить каких то дебилов, две конторы поссорились СНС и ОФОТ из-за чего страдают мирные жители. Ваша задача их помирить и не помереть от болезни, в итоге вы выполняйте задания сразу двух контор, где те друг другу подсирают вашими руками. И ни один из них никак не реагирует на то, что вы работайте на конкурента.
- ГГ не разговаривает, я считаю это колоссальный минус. А вот диалоги врагов отлично сделаны, они в поисках вас, мотивируют себя, переживают за свою жизнь. При том в первой части ГГ был очень разговорчив и было приятно слышать, что он думает. (Да ГГ пишет все свои мысли и т. д. в дневнике, но блин это не то)

Игра классная, советую к прохождению! (Не болейте малярией и будьте здоровы)

185080541.review:
Out of the entire Far Cry franchise, this is the one that depends on survival the most. RPG elements are not the main aspect of the game like the following entries of the franchise so you'll have to use some strategy instead of brute forcing into everything.

Story:
Put simply, you're sent to an anonymous african country to kill "The Jackal", An individual who sells weapons to the biggest 2 factions in the country. Both factions tries to wipe out the other faction and as a result the country went down with them. When you speak with their leaders, each faction obviously tries to justify what they're doing, and they both give you missions in exchange for diamonds while being explicitly clear with you that if you get in trouble, you'll be on your own and they won't come to your help. At least they're honest, no? You also meet friends along the way who ended up in the same country for different reasons, each having their own backstory.

Gameplay:
There are some interesting mechanics in this game. Once you land in the country, you find out later on that you're infected with malaria, and since you can't cure malaria, all you're left with are some suppressant pills given to you by a priest. You can get more pills for completing missions. Now what will happen if you don't take the pills you may ask? Basically the game gets harder. You lose more health, you suffer from dizziness and blurry vision even more, and if your condition worsen, you might fall to the ground unconcious and wake up in the clinic.

Another mechanic is jamming. If you use a weapon for too long, it will start to jam when you shoot, meaning the bullet doesn't come out and you'll have to hit your gun multiple times for it to finally work. Also reloading takes longer for a jammed weapon. If you need a new weapon with no jamming, you can buy one with diamonds and you'll have all-time access to that weapon in certain houses.

Diamonds are the currency of the game. You can get them for completing missions or finding them scattered across the country. There are radars in every car that make a sound when you're close to hidden diamonds to help you find them easier. There are also side missions but they're too repetitive and boring. Most side missions require you to find someone and kill him, and to make matters worse, that person might be on the other side of the map.

If you lose all your health during a fight, a friend might come to your help and save you. But be aware that your friends have health just like you. Which means they can die too, and if they die, they won't come back. You may find your friend laying on the ground asking you for meds to treat his wounds, if you refuse and leave him be, you won't find him anywhere else throughout the game.

Environment is immersive and beautiful. Fires realistically spread everywhere and enemy NPCs are somewhat smart (according to my own experience). Some people will try to hunt you down, for example you may be driving in the roads and out of the blue you find a car running against you at high speed to kill you, and if you're still alive they will fire their guns at you until you take them down. There are also outposts where enemies camp, you can take them down but if you go somewhere else and come back, you'll see new enemies in their place, so it's pointless to kill them every time. My advice is to run past them if you can.

Overall:
If you're looking for another RPG far cry entry, then think twice before trying this one because as I've said earlier it depends on survival more than RPG, in fact RPG elements in this game are almost non-existent. If you tried the other far crys and are looking for a change, go for it.
Also one more thing, signing into ubisoft connect (formerly uplay) is not required.

Average time for completion: 30-40h
Average time for 100% completion: about 50h
Overall score: 8.5/10

одне збереження та завантаження, гра також є бездоганною.

184565607.review:
First Gameplay: https://youtu.be/l_GiARdFJzs

Now this one may have it's own flaws that I will get into later, but this was one great inclusive technological advancement of a game that one can experience. Especially for something that is only 3 GB, they went all out in delivering an epic experience of actually feeling like you're stuck in a far off country and have to fend for yourself. Now as a South African, although I have not learned any Zulu, it features in most of our entertainment media to be familiar with, which one may say can break our experience a little with what the game is supposed to be. But even when you are familiar with the accents and mannerisms, the game still manages to make you feel like you're far away from home through the mechanics and gameplay. I find it inclusive to set a game in Africa and use African languages such as Zulu and Afrikaans to give the gamers a unique experience. The mechanics that I speak of is how the game creates the need for malaria pills in order to survive the wilderness, which also comes with dilemmas in securing the pills through the story that your morality is heavily tested. Unfortunately, this unique mechanic has been replaced by the repetitive towers, skinning animals and make-shift weapons in the latest Far Cry games. Which I am not really complaining about, but their repetitiveness does not add any new experience in order to separate the games from each other based on gameplay and not only animals and plants. Another great mechanic is how guns can jam, as we know if guns are somewhere illegal, then their maintenance can be quite tricky. So guns jamming create a sense of urgency and risk during a shootout, keeping you on your toes and forcing you to think about strategies instead of going out blasting. There is a buddy system too where you have a friend like in the later games, that can come and help you during shootouts and helps revive you whenever you die. I find it crazy that it was not implemented in Far Cry 3 and 4. Although I am not quite sure if they can die for good or only when it is scripted, I do not remember quite well,  but I know that they help with shooting and do not let you do everything on your own, they give you a sense of community that has their own motivations to surivive in the wilderness. This is the game that is praised for how dynamic and realistic the fire is, it spreads with the wind burning all vegetation that you have to mind using bombs and molotovs cocktails in your strategy to take enemies out, or else you will be the one surrounded by fiames. I enjoy the use of a physical phone and map, and how you have to use the map even while driving in order to get where you're going until you learn the landmarks, which are beautifully designed for that reason. Now speaking of the map, the issue transversing, especially between missions, they created their missions to always have to do something on one side of the map, then follow up on the other side of the map. Which makes the game frustrating with long unnecessary travels as it seems it's only for getting gamers to play longer hours and make the map/ game seem bigger, not to mention everytime you travel there's always enemy outposts you have to clear out in order to move through, that will always respawn back when you have to pass there again, which I guess is a point to the newer games. Overall, this is a great game.

Far Cry 2 - это сложная и мрачная история выживания в африканском конфликте. После завершения сюжета остаётся чувство тяжести: весь путь был пропитан предательством, моральными дилеммами и постоянной борьбой за жизнь. 
Сюжет затягивает своей жестокой правдой о войне и людях, оказавшихся в её центре. Главный герой, будучи наёмником, всё больше втягивается в хаос, и к финалу понимаешь, что никто не выйдет из этой истории победителем. 
Геймплей вызывает двойственные чувства: с одной стороны — свобода действий, с другой — изнуряющая рутина постоянных перестрелок и поездок. Ломающееся оружие и приступы малярии добавляют реализма, но порой раздражают. 
Игра оставила яркое впечатление, хотя и не всегда приятное. Это не просто шутер, а история о том, как легко человечность теряется в пламени войны.

184139601.review:
This is legitimately one of the most immersive games I've ever played. The problem is that the role it immerses us in is utterly miserable by design. This game requires commitment and patience like no other. You are a tired, shameless dying mercenary, and Far Cry 2 will not rest until you suffer through every soul-sucking aspect of this gоdforsaken job. There is no humanity here, no levity—no one will ever make a single joke or say something endearing or charismatic in general. There is no drive, no exciting action set pieces, no wild drug trips, no Skrillex grass burning.

You go to one of two absolutely interchangeable faction leaders, who half-heartedly feed you some justification for today’s inhumane atrocity. You routinely visit the gun shop for new weapons, routinely shoot about a million outposts on your way to the job, routinely shoot up the place, routinely suffer malaria attacks, and then repeat the cycle all over again. It makes committing war crimes feel like a grueling dead-end office job without any sense of catharsis whatsoever, and that is kind of the point. I can't stress it enough; none of it is lazy.

Yeah, I know how “the game is annoying and boring on purpose, you guys” sounds, but I swear I’m not crazy here. There are a lot of high-effort details meticulously put in to amplify the dead-end job feeling—from deliciously unpleasant gun-jamming animations to the fact that the guys you’re shooting at will steal your car and one-hit-kill you by running you over if you don’t pay attention. This game from 2008 is still kind of an unbeaten technical marvel in a lot of ways (Jesus Christ, that fire!). I know what lazy, low-effort boring looks like (I just beat The Division), and Far Cry 2 is not it.

I very much respect the hell out of this game; I will sing its praises for how effectively it hammers its point across.

But I will never, EVER play it again. It was enough misery and exhaustion for a lifetime.

183886305.review:
Se tem um jogo que dividiu opiniões na época em que foi lançado, esse jogo foi Far Cry 2. Depois de um primeiro título que misturava ação desenfreada com uns monstros bizarros no meio de uma ilha tropical, a Ubisoft resolveu dar uma guinada de 180 graus. Em vez de mutantes, temos mercenários; em vez de ficção científica, um cenário de guerra brutal na África. Vamos aos pontos altos e baixos, mas já adianto: Far Cry 2 é aquele jogo que você ama ou odeia. 

Pontos Positivos
Um Mundo Aberto Vivo e Cruel
Far Cry 2 te joga num mapa enorme no coração da África, cheio de savanas, selvas e desertos. Você pode ir para onde quiser, mas cuidado: tudo quer te matar. Não tem praia paradisíaca nem descanso. Aqui, o sol queima, as armas emperram e os inimigos não te dão trégua.
E o realismo? Armas enferrujam e quebram, você pega malária e o fogo... Ah, o fogo! Você pode tacar fogo numa moita e, em segundos, ver um incêndio se espalhar igual fofoca no grupo da família.
Gráficos e Clima de Imersão
Para 2008, o visual era absurdo. Você sentia o calor da savana só de olhar para a tela. O ciclo de dia e noite, a chuva repentina, o vento balançando as árvores — parecia que você tava lá. E, diferente do primeiro jogo, aqui a vibe é séria, pesada. Nada de mutantes pulando em você do nada.
História Mais Pé no Chão
Nada de cientistas malucos ou experimentos genéticos. Em Far Cry 2, a história é sobre guerra, poder e sobrevivência. Você é um mercenário caçando um traficante de armas (o famoso Chacal), mas, no meio disso, acaba questionando quem são os verdadeiros vilões. Spoiler: todo mundo é meio podre.
Mecânicas Diferentonas
Além do fogo que a gente já falou, tem a malária que te obriga a buscar remédios, o sistema de aliados (que podem te salvar no meio de um tiroteio) e as armas que falham justo na hora do aperto. Tudo isso deixa o jogo mais tenso e imprevisível.

Pontos Negativos
Missões Repetitivas e chatinhas
"Pega o carro, dirige por 15 minutos, mata uns caras, volta." Repete isso umas 30 vezes e você já sabe como são as missões de Far Cry 2. Parece que esqueceram de variar o roteiro.
Postos de Controle: Um Inferno Sem Fim
Lembra dos postos de controle no mapa? Parece que os inimigos têm um botão de respawn infinito. Você limpa a área, dá meia-volta, e eles já estão lá de novo. É o tipo de coisa que faz você gritar com a tela: "De novo, Ubisoft?!"
Malária: Mais Chata do Que Um Tio no Natal
A ideia de te fazer tomar remédio contra a malária era legal no papel. Mas, na prática, parece que o jogo tá sempre te lembrando: "Ei, você tá doente! Vai buscar remédio!" — e lá vai você parar o que tá fazendo para procurar um médico no meio do nada.
Personagens Pouco Marcantes
Apesar da história ser séria, falta aquele personagem inesquecível. Diferente do primeiro jogo, que tinha vilões e situações mais caricatas, aqui tudo é meio sério demais, quase sem graça.

Enfim, Far Cry 2 é tipo aquele amigo que você respeita, mas não tem paciência pra sair junto todo fim de semana. Ele trouxe várias ideias insanas que mudaram a franquia, como o mundo aberto e a pegada mais realista, mas também exagerou no drama e deixou a diversão de lado em alguns momentos.

Se você gosta de jogos desafiadores e imersivos, vai curtir explorar a África em meio ao caos. Mas, se espera algo mais leve e direto, talvez vá sentir falta da maluquice tropical do primeiro jogo. No fim das contas, Far Cry 2 é como uma fogueira: bonito de longe, mas, se chegar muito perto, você pode se queimar.

183780937.review:
I know this game for a very long time i would say 2019 and played it in an internet cafe somewhere in 2020 or 2021.
I decided to buy it and see for myself.
I enjoyed playing the game. At the beginning I was really fascinated especially by the open world system and the combat, even though this game is quite old and I played other Far Cry games. The setting and plot are interesting and make sense.

 I am going to sum it up without any spoilors. You are in a fictitious African country that is trapped in a civil war between two rival militias. Besides the local warlords it is filled with foreign mercenaries, arms traders. Your mission is to kill the jackal, an abstract person that supplied both sides with arms. You get malaria soon after u come to the country.
What follows is basically ur survival. You have to complete missions for both sides, as well as civilian doctors to get medicine. You can also complete some side quests for arms traffickers which allows you to access new weapons. Well you are basically trapped in a hostile environment and need to survive. You eventually become that what u wanted to destroy, you become some sort of jackal, because your involvment plays a significant role in the game. You end up backing and playing off against the each other the various factions. This is how i see the game's message. 

What I do not like is this task based gameplay. You basically drive across the map from location to location and fulfill missions, which are essentially the same. You have to clear an outpost or smth like that. Occasionally you encounter some interesting missions, make decisions, get new equipment etc. But basically it is the same the whole game. Even though the game is not linear it still offers limited opportunites. You move across the map to marked locations, switch vehicles and return to the same places. Additionally the game shows u how much per cent of the game you fulfilled.

In the end I want to add that the game has some good animations, especially the fire and combat animations, some of which back then were ahead of it's time.

All in all it was a nice experience, but some things disappointed me and it was enough for one playthrough so i probably won't make a second walkthough anytime soon i guess. 
Decide for yourself, but for me it was worth it.
